course.title: Internet Training
course.description: Become proficient in using the internet for communication, research, and productivity.
course.description2: Master the essential skills needed to navigate and utilize the internet effectively for personal and professional use. Learn how to browse safely, use email and cloud services, conduct efficient research, and access online tools for learning, collaboration, and remote work. This training empowers you to stay connected, informed, and digitally competent in today‚Äôs fast-paced online world.
learningOutcomes: Understanding internet basics: browsers, search engines, and online navigation
Creating and managing email accounts (Gmail, Yahoo, etc.)
Using search engines effectively for research and learning
Introduction to cloud tools like Google Drive and OneDrive
Understanding cybersecurity basics: passwords, phishing, and safe browsing
Utilizing online platforms for learning and communication (Zoom, Google Meet)
Accessing social media for professional networking and branding
Hands-on practice with online forms, surveys, and submissions
Introduction to e-commerce and digital payments
Using Google Docs, Sheets, and Slides for productivity
Collaborative tools and cloud sharing techniques
Navigating online job platforms and remote work opportunities

course.title: Desktop Publishing
course.description: Master professional document design and layout techniques
course.description2: Master professional document design and layout techniques that bring clarity, consistency, and visual appeal to your work. Learn how to apply advanced formatting, align content for readability, and use typography, spacing, and color schemes to enhance message delivery. You‚Äôll also gain skills in structuring multi-page reports, brochures, proposals, and branded templates that reflect industry-standard quality and professional excellence across various platforms.
learningOutcomes: Introduction to Desktop Publishing and its real-world applications
Mastery of Microsoft Word: formatting, templates, mail merge, and page design
Creating professional spreadsheets and charts using Microsoft Excel
Using Excel functions and formulas for data analysis and reporting
Designing engaging presentations with Microsoft PowerPoint
Inserting animations, transitions, multimedia, and SmartArt in slides
File management and document security across Office applications
Creating business documents like invoices, letters, and reports
Page layout and document design principles for publishing
Hands-on projects to reinforce practical skills across Office tools
Keyboarding and typing speed improvement techniques
Using Office tools for branding: flyers, business cards, and posters
Collaboration tools: track changes, comments, and cloud sharing

course.title: Graphics Design
course.description: Create stunning visual designs for digital and print media
course.description2: Create stunning visual designs for digital and print media that leave a lasting impression. Learn to bring your creative ideas to life using professional tools and industry-standard techniques. From social media graphics and website banners to brochures, flyers, and business cards, you'll master the art of combining color, typography, and layout to communicate messages effectively across any platform. Whether you're designing for screens or paper, this course equips you with the skills to deliver polished, eye-catching results that meet both creative and professional standards.
learningOutcomes: Introduction to Computer Fundamentals and Office Applications
Basics of Graphic Design Principles and Visual Communication
Proficiency in Microsoft Word: Document formatting, templates, and layout
Microsoft PowerPoint: Creating visually engaging slide presentations
Microsoft Excel: Using spreadsheets for design budgeting and planning
Understanding Color Theory, Typography, and Layouts
Designing Professional Flyers, Posters, and Business Cards
Using Microsoft Publisher for Desktop Publishing
File Management: Saving, exporting, and sharing design files
Applying Design Elements in Real-World Office Tasks
Creating Reports, Infographics, and Visual Data Presentations
Hands-on Practice with Real-Life Design Projects

course.title: Computer Engineering
course.description: Learn the foundations of hardware, software, and system design.
course.description2: Dive into the fundamentals of computer engineering, covering both hardware and software aspects of modern computing systems. Gain practical experience in system architecture, microprocessors, digital electronics, operating systems, and troubleshooting techniques. This course is ideal for those who want to build, maintain, or optimize computing systems and networks in real-world environments.
learningOutcomes: Introduction to computer systems and basic components
Understanding the roles of CPU, RAM, storage, and motherboard
Assembling and disassembling desktop PCs and laptops
Identifying and troubleshooting hardware issues
Installing and configuring operating systems (Windows/Linux)
Basic networking concepts and LAN setup
Understanding BIOS/UEFI and system boot processes
Working with microcontrollers and digital logic
Introduction to programming for embedded systems
Preventive maintenance and hardware upgrades
Safe handling and protection of electronic components
Understanding power supply units and circuit diagnostics
Hands-on labs and project-based assessments

course.title: Business Machine Techniques
course.description: Learn to operate and maintain essential office machines for modern business tasks.
course.description2: Gain hands-on knowledge in operating and maintaining key business machines such as photocopiers, scanners, binding machines, laminators, shredders, and multi-function printers. Understand their uses in administrative workflows, improve document handling efficiency, and troubleshoot basic faults. This course empowers you with practical skills needed in today's digital-office environments.
learningOutcomes: Understanding the role of business machines in office environments
Hands-on operation of printers, scanners, and copiers
Document finishing techniques: binding, laminating, and cutting
Routine maintenance and safety precautions
Troubleshooting common machine issues
Workplace productivity using business tools
Basic record keeping and inventory of machine supplies

course.title: Data Processing
course.description: Master the core concepts of data entry, analysis, and digital record keeping.
course.description2: This course introduces you to the world of data processing‚Äîfrom data entry to analysis and reporting. Learn to use industry-standard software such as Microsoft Excel, Access, and basic database tools to handle, organize, and interpret structured data for business and academic purposes.
learningOutcomes: Introduction to data types and data structures
Data entry standards and accuracy techniques
Using Microsoft Excel for data sorting, filtering, and formulas
Understanding spreadsheets and cell referencing
Intro to Microsoft Access and relational databases
Data visualization using charts and graphs
Basic data validation and analysis
Creating digital records and generating reports

course.title: Laptop Engineering
course.description: Learn the fundamentals of laptop hardware maintenance and repair.
course.description2: Get trained in diagnosing, servicing, and repairing laptops. From screen replacements to motherboard diagnosis, this course teaches both the theoretical knowledge and hands-on techniques required to service modern laptops professionally. Ideal for aspiring technicians and tech enthusiasts.
learningOutcomes: Understanding laptop architecture and components
Disassembling and reassembling laptops safely
Screen, keyboard, and touchpad replacements
Battery, RAM, and hard drive upgrades
BIOS flashing and OS installation
Diagnosing power and charging issues
Basic soldering techniques
Troubleshooting hardware and software problems

course.title: Computer Engineering
course.description: Build a solid foundation in computer hardware, software, and system architecture.
course.description2: This course explores both the hardware and software aspects of computer systems. Learn how computers work from the ground up‚Äîunderstanding CPUs, memory, storage, and input/output systems. It also covers installation of operating systems, drivers, and utilities necessary for system performance and optimization.
learningOutcomes: Computer system fundamentals: CPU, RAM, motherboard
PC assembly and troubleshooting
Installing and configuring operating systems
Driver management and software installation
System performance tuning and benchmarking
Troubleshooting hardware conflicts
Power supply and peripheral integration
Health and safety practices in PC repair

course.title: Computer Networking
course.description: Understand how computer networks are built, configured, and secured.
course.description2: Dive into the essentials of computer networking‚Äîlearn how data flows through wired and wireless networks, understand network protocols, and practice setting up secure and functional network environments. This course is ideal for IT beginners, support staff, and anyone preparing for networking certifications.
learningOutcomes: Introduction to LAN, WAN, and wireless networking
Understanding IP addressing and subnetting
Setting up routers, switches, and access points
Network cabling and signal testing
Understanding TCP/IP and key protocols
Basic network security and firewall configuration
Troubleshooting connectivity issues
Hands-on lab setup using virtual network tools

course.title: Programming
course.description: Learn to code with modern programming languages and frameworks
course.description2: Learn to code with modern programming languages and frameworks that power today‚Äôs web and mobile applications. Master essential skills in HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and React while gaining hands-on experience building real-world projects. Whether you're starting from scratch or upskilling, this course equips you with practical tools and current industry standards needed to thrive in today‚Äôs fast-moving tech landscape. You'll also develop problem-solving techniques and learn how to collaborate using version control systems like Git. Stay ahead with the latest trends in frontend development, responsive design, and component-based architectures.
learningOutcomes: Understand the structure of web pages using HTML5
Create headings, paragraphs, lists, forms, tables, and semantic tags
Learn best practices for clean, accessible markup
Embed images, videos, and iframes
Build the foundation of every web page
Style web pages with colors, layouts, fonts, and animations using CSS
Master Flexbox and Grid for responsive design
Create interactive effects with transitions and hover states
Organize styles using classes, IDs, and pseudo-selectors
Learn media queries for mobile-first development
Add interactivity and logic to web pages using JavaScript
Understand variables, data types, loops, functions, and events
Manipulate the DOM to create dynamic pages
Use Fetch API to load and send data
Learn debugging techniques and JS best practices
Build dynamic, reusable components with React
Understand JSX, state, props, and component lifecycles
Manage application state using hooks like useState and useEffect
Route pages with React Router
Build single-page applications (SPAs)
Integrate APIs and handle async data
Develop real web apps like portfolios, dashboards, and blogs
Use version control with Git & GitHub
Deploy projects online using Netlify or Vercel
Practice problem-solving and responsive design
Build and deploy complete frontend web applications
Create modern, mobile-friendly websites
Build a portfolio of projects showcasing frontend development skills

course.title: Cinematography
course.description: Learn the art and science of visual storytelling through camera and lighting.
course.description2: This course introduces the core principles of cinematography, including camera techniques, shot composition, lighting, and post-production editing. You'll gain hands-on experience in using video equipment, directing scenes, and capturing powerful visuals that tell compelling stories. Ideal for aspiring filmmakers, content creators, and anyone looking to explore the visual side of storytelling through film and video.
learningOutcomes: Introduction to cinematography and visual storytelling
Understanding camera types, lenses, and basic operations
Mastering the rules of composition and framing
Using lighting setups to create mood and enhance visuals
Shooting techniques: handheld, tripod, dolly, and more
Understanding exposure, aperture, ISO, and shutter speed
Directing simple scenes and coordinating small shoots
Recording and syncing clean audio during video production
Basic video editing and post-production workflows
Color grading fundamentals and visual consistency
Creating short videos and storytelling projects
Portfolio development: documenting and presenting your work
